_source.content: "In a letter to ERIC Executive Director Shane Hamlin, Missouri Secretary of State John Ashcroft cited ERIC‚Äôs failure to address Missouri‚Äôs concerns as the reason the state is withdrawing from the pact.Those concerns, Ashcroft wrote, include refusing to 'require member states to participate in addressing multi-state voter fraud'; focusing on 'adding names to voter rolls by requiring a solicitation to individuals who already had an opportunity to register to vote and made the conscious decision to not be registered'; allowing 'for a hyper-partisan individual to be an ex-officio non-voting member on its governance board'; and unnecessarily restricting 'how Missouri utilizes data reports.'Another concern the state leaders expressed was the requirement for states to share confidential voter data ‚Äî usually DMV or social services data ‚Äî with ERIC."- Victoria Marshallhttps://thefederalist.com/2023/03/06/florida-missouri-and-west-virginia-withdraw-from-leftist-controlled-voter-roll-maintenance-group-eric/
_source.contentraw:
"In a letter to ERIC Executive Director Shane Hamlin, Missouri Secretary of State John Ashcroft cited ERIC‚Äôs failure to address Missouri‚Äôs concerns as the reason the state is withdrawing from the pact.

Those concerns, Ashcroft wrote, include refusing to 'require member states to participate in addressing multi-state voter fraud'; focusing on 'adding names to voter rolls by requiring a solicitation to individuals who already had an opportunity to register to vote and made the conscious decision to not be registered'; allowing 'for a hyper-partisan individual to be an ex-officio non-voting member on its governance board'; and unnecessarily restricting 'how Missouri utilizes data reports.'

Another concern the state leaders expressed was the requirement for states to share confidential voter data ‚Äî usually DMV or social services data ‚Äî with ERIC."
- Victoria Marshall

https://thefederalist.com/2023/03/06/florida-missouri-and-west-virginia-withdraw-from-leftist-controlled-voter-roll-maintenance-group-eric/

This is similar to what the Florida's Secretary of State Cord Byrd's letter said.
Please copy and paste and send to your SOS ASAP:


DEAR SOS ________:
I am calling on you to withdrew from the Electronic Registration Information Center (ERIC). (ADD Name of Your State) must terminate our ERIC Membership immediately. ERIC refuses to secure data and eliminate its partisan tendencies. Withdrawing from ERIC will ensure that the data privacy of (Your State)'s voters is protected. You MUST protect the personal information of (Your State)‚Äôs citizens BUT the ERIC agreement requires this information to be shared. This is a betrayal of voters in our state.
In 2022, a working group of ERIC member states was formed and proposed necessary changes to the ERIC Membership agreement. These reforms would have eliminated concerns about ERIC‚Äôs potential partisan leanings, and made the information shared with ERIC more secure. The working group‚Äôs proposals included increased protections for confidential voter information and limiting the power of ex-officio partisan members of the ERIC board. These ex-officio partisan members are not representatives of specific states and have undue influence over the organization and its decisions.
ERIC dismissed and refused to address these significant issues of electoral integrity, therefore, it is in the best interest of (Your State) , its citizens, and its voters to withdraw its membership from ERIC.

card.description:
Angry Battle Dwarf Gimli on Gab: 'Find out if you have the voter "registration" system called ERIC in your state. If you do, know this: you'll never fairly win an election ever again. 

If you want to start fighting back, I will show you how and I will provide you with the ERIC files. I just dropped this on our county prosecutor's desk along with 236 files of research and a completed diagram of the entire ERIC system.

So what's it going to be?

_________________________________

March 7, 2023

Election officials, and elected officials of the State of Michigan have processed and catalogued voters in the State of Michigan in a ‚Äúnot for profit‚Äù private voter registration system known as ERIC (Electronic Registration Information Center). This privately controlled voter registration system (‚ÄúERIC‚Äù) records personal data across the entire nation. This data is known to be visible to individuals who are arbitrarily placed on ‚ÄúThe Board‚Äù for ERIC, and not voted for, approved, nor even announced to the voting public in the state of Michigan. 

The citizens of the State of Michigan did not request this registration in the ERIC system. The citizens did not approve of this registration in the ERIC system. The vast, greater majority of the citizens of the State of Michigan have no idea at all that they have been involuntarily registered in the ERIC system. 

This presents legal challenges on multiple levels, from simple invasion of privacy to potential voter fraud to flagrant manipulation and exposure of election data to unknown entities and persons. 

It is recommended that the various counties of the State of Michigan examine these facts, and demand the removal of the State of Michigan from the unlawful, privatized registration system known as ERIC. 

States already removing their citizens from ERIC:
-	Louisiana
-	Alabama
-	Florida
-	Missouri
-	West Virginia

See: accompanying electronic files with complete ‚Äúmap‚Äù of the entire ERIC network and structure, and associated persons.

_source.content: The following is the testimony of my son Pastor Eric.  "When I was watching the new movie "Jesus Revolution" I noticed the awesome art work on the character Lonnie Frisbee‚Äôs jacket.It reminded me of my own that I made after I was saved in high-school. I was full of passion and burden to share Jesus with my campus and anyone else that would listen.That zeal spilled out into the streets of downtown Portland in nights of sharing Christ with the homeless, skinheads, King Diamond concerts, gutter punks, cults and normies. I cut my ministry teeth on wild times of glory and Fire with brothers and sisters overcome with the love of Jesus.We were a mess of broken but resurrected young people. Immature, but reclaimed by Jesus. Sinners becoming the saints God had made, confused on a lot but courageous and full of conviction that fueled our zealous lives.Our tribe of young Jesus freaks pursued the Lord through communal life together, hosting Bible studies, prayer and worship times, campus witnessing, concerts, late night coffee-shop God talk and coffee guzzling, door to door evangelism and when we had extra time we‚Äôd go‚Ä¶to church services too."Eric was saved 33 years ago and has faithfully served the least the last and the lost full time in ministry ever since. He Pastors Jacob's Well in Spokane Wa. in the heart of the working poor district.
_source.contentraw:
The following is the testimony of my son Pastor Eric.

"When I was watching the new movie "Jesus Revolution" I noticed the awesome art work on the character Lonnie Frisbee‚Äôs jacket.

It reminded me of my own that I made after I was saved in high-school. I was full of passion and burden to share Jesus with my campus and anyone else that would listen.

That zeal spilled out into the streets of downtown Portland in nights of sharing Christ with the homeless, skinheads, King Diamond concerts, gutter punks, cults and normies. I cut my ministry teeth on wild times of glory and Fire with brothers and sisters overcome with the love of Jesus.

We were a mess of broken but resurrected young people. Immature, but reclaimed by Jesus. Sinners becoming the saints God had made, confused on a lot but courageous and full of conviction that fueled our zealous lives.

Our tribe of young Jesus freaks pursued the Lord through communal life together, hosting Bible studies, prayer and worship times, campus witnessing, concerts, late night coffee-shop God talk and coffee guzzling, door to door evangelism and when we had extra time we‚Äôd go‚Ä¶to church services too."

Eric was saved 33 years ago and has faithfully served the least the last and the lost full time in ministry ever since. He Pastors Jacob's Well in Spokane Wa. in the heart of the working poor district.

group.description:
This moderated group is for born-again believers, centered on Christ and the Bible to minister in the following ways:
-present the gospel
-make disciples.
-serve the needs of brothers and sisters in Christ by the Spirit.

This group is for sharing and caring in Christ. It is not for current events, prophetic speculation, philosophy, politics, secular interests, religiosity,  advertisements or promotions.

Posts contrary to the above stated 3 missions may be removed at the discretion of the moderators. Likewise, if anyone continues contrary to solid biblical doctrine or continues publishing off-topic or provokes division, that person may be removed from the group at the discretion of the moderators.
This group is in the tradition of under shepherds such as Wycliffe, Zwingli, Tyndale, Spurgeon, D.L. Moody, Warren W. Wiersbe, J, Vernon McGee,  John MacArthur (to name a few & give a clue).

We agree with the statement of faith found here:

The following is the testimony of my son Pastor Eric.

"When I was watching the new movie "Jesus Revolution" I noticed the awesome art work on the character Lonnie Frisbee‚Äôs jacket.

It reminded me of my own that I made after I was saved in high-school. I was full of passion and burden to share Jesus with my campus and anyone else that would listen.

That zeal spilled out into the streets of downtown Portland in nights of sharing Christ with the homeless, skinheads, King Diamond concerts, gutter punks, cults and normies. I cut my ministry teeth on wild times of glory and Fire with brothers and sisters overcome with the love of Jesus.

We were a mess of broken but resurrected young people. Immature, but reclaimed by Jesus. Sinners becoming the saints God had made, confused on a lot but courageous and full of conviction that fueled our zealous lives.

Our tribe of young Jesus freaks pursued the Lord through communal life together, hosting Bible studies, prayer and worship times, campus witnessing, concerts, late night coffee-shop God talk and coffee guzzling, door to door evangelism and when we had extra time we‚Äôd go‚Ä¶to church services too."

Eric was saved 33 years ago and has faithfully served the least the last and the lost full time in ministry ever since. He Pastors Jacob's Well in Spokane Wa. in the heart of the working poor district.

My reasoning? I believe this: "Never doubt God‚Äôs mighty power to work in you and accomplish all this. He will achieve infinitely more than your greatest request, your most unbelievable dream, and exceed your wildest imagination! He will outdo them all, for his miraculous power constantly energizes you.‚Äù Ephesians 3:20 TPT

***PLEASE READ BEFORE POSTING: Posts that are encouraged (think ENGAGEMENT! and WHAT IS GOD TELLING YOU!):

1. Testimonies, praise reports, prayer requests, encouragements, prophecies, words from God, exhortations, etc.

2. Questions of those looking to our community for answers that only God can give.

3. Sermons, articles, videos, pictures and verses as long as they have a good description outlining who, what, where, why and how. If you don't respect the link you are posting or the other Christians in the group enough to take some time with your post, please don't post it. 

***It seems most just post and run (seagull posting) and this is not God's heart nor mine. This group has ONE timeline. It also has many members. Is it respectful on your part to post several one-line posts in a row pushing someone else's well-thought post or plea out of sight of the group? 

With that in mind the following types of posts will be removed at the sole discretion of the moderators:
1. Off-topic posts: politics, flat earth, begging for followers or money (please reach out to the admin if you believe you have a worthy fundraising cause. You will be required to provide proof and cause. Any fundraiser posted without prior discussion will be removed), promoting personal agendas, etc.

2. Intentionally divisive, argumentative, disrespectful or racist posts.

3. Low effort (Just posting a video/link is not sufficient within the group, you must also write YOUR OWN description of the link/video; the included video/link description is not acceptable) or multiple posts in a row (limit of 2 posts per 3 hours)

4. Posts that don't meet the criteria mentioned above

5. Any reposts from other groups that are unrelated to Christianity; reposts of posts already in the group timeline (if you agree with a post just say it in the original post); and any reposts of your disagreements within a post brought to the group timeline.

6. Anyone who spams the same post to multiple groups (yes, I check timelines), or continually posts the same post/s in the timeline. 

7. All members who block the administrators and moderators will be removed.

***Remember that we are the body of Christ. Please keep your posts in line with Philippians 4:8 (ESV): Finally, brothers, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence, if there is anything worthy of praise, think (post!) about these things.

***‚ÄúThe Lord bless you and keep you; the Lord make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you; the Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace. ‚ÄúSo shall they put my name upon the people of Israel, and I will bless them.‚Äù Numbers 6:24-27 ESV

_source.content: I usually pride myself on my basic 80s knowledge and so with this in mind, I try to fill in the gaps on things that I know of that I let slip by.  So it was only a day or two ago I finally watched Dirty Dancing.  As for the movie:  Soundtrack was an awesome mix of 60's hits with songs specific to the movie (such as the great Eric Carmen's "Hungry Eyes" and The Duet of Bill Medley and Jennifer Warnes doing the great song "Time of my Life").  I found it strange watching fellow raised (partially) in Northeast Pennsylvania Jerry Orbach not cracking jokes since I was used to his character from Law and Order.  He was about the most tolerant father since Baby seemed to repeatedly lie to him.  Baby, for her part, was your typical teenage girl for that era, which was the summer of '63.  But the standout performance was Johnny played by Patrick Swayze.  He was a mix of everything and he kept it on point. Would I watch it again?  Absolutely!Now I included the link to the REAL Kellerman's.  Looks like about the most awesome place to visit! https://www.mtnlakelodge.com/
_source.contentraw:
I usually pride myself on my basic 80s knowledge and so with this in mind, I try to fill in the gaps on things that I know of that I let slip by. So it was only a day or two ago I finally watched Dirty Dancing.

As for the movie: Soundtrack was an awesome mix of 60's hits with songs specific to the movie (such as the great Eric Carmen's "Hungry Eyes" and The Duet of Bill Medley and Jennifer Warnes doing the great song "Time of my Life").

I found it strange watching fellow raised (partially) in Northeast Pennsylvania Jerry Orbach not cracking jokes since I was used to his character from Law and Order. He was about the most tolerant father since Baby seemed to repeatedly lie to him.

Baby, for her part, was your typical teenage girl for that era, which was the summer of '63.

But the standout performance was Johnny played by Patrick Swayze. He was a mix of everything and he kept it on point.

Would I watch it again? Absolutely!

Now I included the link to the REAL Kellerman's. Looks like about the most awesome place to visit!

https://www.mtnlakelodge.com/

_source.content: "If there was ever a question that's in the public's interest to know, it's what actually happened on January 6," Carlson said. "By definition, this video will reveal it. It's impossible for me to understand why any honest person would be bothered by that."Democrats are worried that the release of such videos will reveal sensitive security details about the Capitol, including the placement of cameras, evacuation routes, and floor layouts."Releasing sensitive material related to the 1/6 insurrection to a single TV personality, on a network that continues to push disinformation about that attack, is outrageous and unacceptable," tweeted Sen. Alex Padilla, D-Calif.Rep. Eric Swalwell, D-Calif., echoed similar sentiments, telling MSNBC that there's "no good ending" here and that the footage could be used for "the next insurrection.""It's either going to be used to distort what happened on January 6th by Tucker Carlson, or you just gave the proudest boy of all a blueprint for the Capitol," Swalwell said.'https://www.salon.com/2023/03/06/egregious-security-breach-experts-alarmed-over-mccarthys-unusual-fox-news-jan-6-footage-deal/
_source.contentraw:
"If there was ever a question that's in the public's interest to know, it's what actually happened on January 6," Carlson said. "By definition, this video will reveal it. It's impossible for me to understand why any honest person would be bothered by that."

Democrats are worried that the release of such videos will reveal sensitive security details about the Capitol, including the placement of cameras, evacuation routes, and floor layouts.

"Releasing sensitive material related to the 1/6 insurrection to a single TV personality, on a network that continues to push disinformation about that attack, is outrageous and unacceptable," tweeted Sen. Alex Padilla, D-Calif.

Rep. Eric Swalwell, D-Calif., echoed similar sentiments, telling MSNBC that there's "no good ending" here and that the footage could be used for "the next insurrection."

"It's either going to be used to distort what happened on January 6th by Tucker Carlson, or you just gave the proudest boy of all a blueprint for the Capitol," Swalwell said.'

https://www.salon.com/2023/03/06/egregious-security-breach-experts-alarmed-over-mccarthys-unusual-fox-news-jan-6-footage-deal/

_source.content: NY Court Workers Fired for Refusing COVID Vax Must Be Rehired With Back Pay as State Board Scraps MandateNew York Post reported:New York court workers must be rehired ‚Äî and given back pay with interest ‚Äî if they were fired because they refused to get the COVID-19 vaccine, the state‚Äôs Public Employment Relations Board has ruled.Under terms of the decision issued last month, the Unified Court System must immediately ‚Äúcease and desist‚Äù from enforcing policies that require all non-judicial employees to be vaccinated or undergo regular testing. In addition, anyone ‚Äúwho lost accrued leave, compensation or employment‚Äù will have to be made ‚Äúwhole,‚Äù with interest paid ‚Äúat the maximum legal rate,‚Äù according to the Feb. 24 decision obtained by The Post.The decision affects at least about 25 court officers who were fired, said Dennis Quirk, president of the New York State Court Officers Association, one of 10 unions that challenged the mandate.It‚Äôs unclear whether the decision will affect other state and Big Apple government employees who refused to get vaccinated, some of whom are suing New York City. A spokesperson for Mayor Eric Adams said the ruling won‚Äôt apply to city workers because it was ‚Äúbased on a different set of facts and laws‚Äù than those governing Big Apple employees.
_source.contentraw:
NY Court Workers Fired for Refusing COVID Vax Must Be Rehired With Back Pay as State Board Scraps Mandate
New York Post reported:

New York court workers must be rehired ‚Äî and given back pay with interest ‚Äî if they were fired because they refused to get the COVID-19 vaccine, the state‚Äôs Public Employment Relations Board has ruled.

Under terms of the decision issued last month, the Unified Court System must immediately ‚Äúcease and desist‚Äù from enforcing policies that require all non-judicial employees to be vaccinated or undergo regular testing. In addition, anyone ‚Äúwho lost accrued leave, compensation or employment‚Äù will have to be made ‚Äúwhole,‚Äù with interest paid ‚Äúat the maximum legal rate,‚Äù according to the Feb. 24 decision obtained by The Post.

The decision affects at least about 25 court officers who were fired, said Dennis Quirk, president of the New York State Court Officers Association, one of 10 unions that challenged the mandate.

It‚Äôs unclear whether the decision will affect other state and Big Apple government employees who refused to get vaccinated, some of whom are suing New York City. A spokesperson for Mayor Eric Adams said the ruling won‚Äôt apply to city workers because it was ‚Äúbased on a different set of facts and laws‚Äù than those governing Big Apple employees.

The New York Police Department is advising businesses to ask patrons to take off their masks before entry in light of the high number of thefts and robberies across the city.

Removing masks should be made a ‚Äúcondition of entry,‚Äù NYPD Chief of Department Jeffrey Maddrey said at a press conference last week, noting that criminals have been taking advantage of masks to avoid detection on surveillance cameras.

‚ÄúPeople are coming up to our businesses, sometimes with masks, hoods and latex gloves, and they‚Äôre being buzzed in, they‚Äôre being allowed to enter into the store and then we have a robbery or some kind of property being stolen,‚Äù Maddrey said.

‚ÄúWe are asking the businesses to make this a condition of entry: That people, when they come in, they show their face, they should identify themselves,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúAnd if they feel like they want to put their mask on after they identify themselves for their safety, by all means, they should do so.‚Äù

---

The advice comes as New York City Mayor Eric Adams admitted that a shoplifting epidemic is forcing chain stores to close down and costing retail workers their jobs.

‚ÄúPeople who say that we‚Äôre criminalizing the poor‚Äîthey‚Äôre wrong,‚Äù Adam said at a Feb. 12 budget hearing in Albany as he made the case for billions in additional state funding for his city. ‚ÄúPoor and low-income New Yorkers are being unemployed because we‚Äôre losing those businesses in our city.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre losing chain stores that are closing down. People who are being employed in those stores are losing their jobs,‚Äù the mayor told the state Legislature. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre adding to our unemployment.‚Äù

The surge in shoplifting has prompted some business owners to take action on their own.

Florida Governor Ron DeSOROS had advance knowledge of the FBI‚Äôs August 8 raid on President Donald J. Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago estate but chose not to warn him that an army of federal goons was about to descend on Palm Beach like a swarm of locusts, according to a new White Hat study General Eric M. Smith shared with his council on Tuesday.

The report, authored by U.S. Army Cyber Command and Marine Corps Forces Cyberspace Command, asserts that DeSantis entertained AG Merrick Garland at the governor‚Äôs mansion in Tallahassee on July 25, two weeks ahead of the raid. It states that the joint cyber command task force acquired surveillance footage of Garland and two unidentified men arriving at DeSantis‚Äô home at 8:00 p.m. that evening.

That alone, our source said, sounded alarm bells; Gen. Smith saw no reason why DeSoros, who has sharply criticized the regime, would for any reason sit down with Garland, who has weaponized the Department of Justice to target law-abiding patriots. Moreover, the meeting appeared clandestine because neither the Justice Dept. nor DeSoros‚Äô camp publicly mentioned the gathering.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs nothing technically criminal about the meeting. DeSoros can invite anyone he wants into his home, but it was highly suspicious, in retrospect, knowing now that they met in secret shortly before the unlawful occupation of President Trump‚Äôs home.

Although Trump had yet to triumphantly announce he would seek an ‚Äòofficial‚Äô return to the White House in 2024, DeSoros might have been fishing for dirt to further impugn Trump‚Äôs unimpeachable character, our source added.

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt know if DeSoros wanted the presidency before midterms. But if expected to win, as he did, he could‚Äôve made advance moves, maybe hoping the raid would be damaging enough to make President Trump get out of his way. Trump didn‚Äôt announce until much later, but DeSoros undoubtedly saw Trump as an unbeatable opponent,‚Äù our source said.

Other information on the report cemented Gen. Smith‚Äôs hypothesis that DeSoros was conspiring with Merrick Garland to topple Trump. Cyberspace Command reportedly has text messages in which Garland writes, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre coming,‚Äù and DeSoros responds, ‚ÄúThanks for the heads up,‚Äù‚Äîtimestamped three hours before the FBI swarm illegally and unprecedently violated the home of a President of the United States.

Several members of the White Hat Council believe DeSoros is a Trojan Horse, a globalist masquerading as a freedom-loving Republican whose anti-woke rhetoric is merely a ruse to beguile voters, and whose true ambition, if he sits in the Oval Office, is to deepen The Swamp an enrich a corrupt federal government. However, a holdout on the council still sees DeSantis as the better option and has called the texts ‚Äúinnocuous and inconclusive.‚Äù

Like his predecessor Gen. David H. Berger, General Smith says DeSoros committed unforgivable atrocities by allowing FEMA to terrorize Floridians during last year‚Äôs Hurricane Ian.

Asked if White Hats are building a case against DeSoros, he said, ‚ÄúEven if I knew, I couldn‚Äôt say. But there‚Äôs overwhelming animus toward him. The majority of the armed forces stand with President Trump.‚Äù
